headline.main: U.S. Confidence in Police at 22-Year Low: Gallup Poll
headline.print_headline: U.S. Confidence in Police at 22-Year Low: Gallup Poll

docs.snippet: Confidence in police in the United States has dropped to the lowest level in more than two decades, with just 52 percent of Americans expressing "a great deal" or "quite a lot" of confidence, according to a Gallup poll released on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Confidence in police in the United States has dropped to the lowest level in more than two decades, with just 52 percent of Americans expressing "a great deal" or "quite a lot" of confidence, according to a Gallup poll released on Friday.

headline.main: Peugeot to Invest $632 Million in Morocco Car Factory
headline.print_headline: Peugeot to Invest $632 Million in Morocco Car Factory

docs.snippet: Morocco and French automaker PSA Peugeot Citroen on Friday signed an accord to build a new factory aimed at producing up to 200,000 cars annually for the African and Middle East market....
docs.lead_paragraph: Morocco and French automaker PSA Peugeot Citroen on Friday signed an accord to build a new factory aimed at producing up to 200,000 cars annually for the African and Middle East market.

headline.main: U.S. to Fast Track $29 Million to Help Charleston Shooting Victims' Families
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Fast Track $29 Million to Help Charleston Shooting Victims' Families

docs.snippet: The Justice Department will fast track the sending of $29 million to South Carolina to help families of victims of the mass murder of nine churchgoers at a historic black church in Charleston, a Justice Department spokesman said on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department will fast track the sending of $29 million to South Carolina to help families of victims of the mass murder of nine churchgoers at a historic black church in Charleston, a Justice Department spokesman said on Friday.

headline.main: An Angry Martin O’Malley Calls for an Assault Weapons Ban

docs.snippet: Martin O’Malley, a Democratic candidate for president, emailed supporters calling for a new national assault weapons ban and other gun control measures after the shooting deaths in a South Carolina church this week....
docs.abstract: Martin O’Malley, a Democratic candidate for president, emailed supporters calling for a new national assault weapons ban and other gun control measures after the shooting deaths in a South Carolina church this week.

headline.main: Syrian hospital at risk due to fuel crisis
headline.sub: Syrian hospital at risk due to fuel crisis

docs.snippet: Doctors at an Idlib hospital say lives are at risk once electricity runs out and machines turn off. Jillian Kitchener reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors at an Idlib hospital say lives are at risk once electricity runs out and machines turn off. Jillian Kitchener reports.

headline.main: Grant Park Prepares for Taste of Chicago 2015

docs.snippet: The annual Taste of Chicago festival has a menu that includes Thai dishes, fried chicken and, of course, the city’s signature deep-dish pizza....
docs.lead_paragraph: The annual Taste of Chicago festival has a menu that includes Thai dishes, fried chicken and, of course, the city’s signature deep-dish pizza.

headline.main: Joker Isaev Keeps Cool Head to Land Taekwondo Gold for Hosts
headline.print_headline: Joker Isaev Keeps Cool Head to Land Taekwondo Gold for Hosts

docs.snippet: World champion Radik Isaev, who has a reputation as a joker, handed hosts Azerbaijan another European Games gold when he got the better of Russian Vladislav Larin in a tense men's taekwondo +80kg final on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: World champion Radik Isaev, who has a reputation as a joker, handed hosts Azerbaijan another European Games gold when he got the better of Russian Vladislav Larin in a tense men's taekwondo +80kg final on Friday.

headline.main: Top Teams Set for Women's World Cup Knockout Stage
headline.print_headline: Top Teams Set for Women's World Cup Knockout Stage

docs.snippet: The Women's World Cup enters what is expected to be a thrilling single-game knockout stage in Canada on Saturday with no clear- cut favourite after the top seeds all won their groups....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Women's World Cup enters what is expected to be a thrilling single-game knockout stage in Canada on Saturday with no clear- cut favourite after the top seeds all won their groups.

headline.main: Opposing Viewpoints on Charleston and Guns

docs.snippet: Gun-control supporters and critics are actively debating gun laws in the wake of the Charleston church shooting....
